statement: What do we remember on Anzac Day?

answers.answer: The landing of the Australian and New Zealand Army Corps at Gallipoli, Turkey
The arrival of the first free settlers from Great Britain
The landing of the First Fleet at Sydney Cove

comment: Anzac Day는 25 April. Anzac은 Australian and New Zealnad Army Corps의 약자

statement: What are the colours of the Australian Aboriginal Flag?

answers.answer: Black, red and yellow
Green, white and black
Blue, white and green

comment: 원주민기의 색깔은? 상단 절반인 black은 원주민, 하단 절반인 red는 땅, yellow circle은 태양을 의미

statement: Which official symbol of Australia identifies Commonwealth property?

answers.answer: The national anthem
Australia's national flower
Commonwealth Coat of Arms

comment: 연방정부의 소유권을 나타내는 호주의 공식상징은? 연방 정부 문장은 호주 연방정부의 공식 표상이다

statement: Which of these statements about Australia's system of government is correct?

answers.answer: The Queen of Australia chooses people to form the Australian Parliament
The government is elected by the people
The Prime Minister chooses our Members of Parliament

comment: 호주 정부체제에 대한 바른 설명은? 정부는 국민에 의해 선출된다.

statement: Which of these is an example of freedom of speech?

answers.answer: People can peacefully protest against government decisions
Men and women are treated equally in a court of law
Australians are free to not follow a religion

comment: 언론의 자유에 해당하는 것은? 정부의 결정에 평화롭게 항의할 수 있다.

statement: Which of these statements about government in Australia is correct?

answers.answer: The government does not allow some religions
Government in Australia is secular
Religious laws are passed by parliament

comment: 호주정부에 대한 설명이 바른 것은? 호주정부는 세속정부이다. 즉, 특정종교를 표방하지 않음.

statement: Which of these is an example of equality in Australia?

answers.answer: Everyone follows the same religion
Men and women have the same rights
Everyone belongs to the same political party

comment: 평등에 대한 예는? 남녀가 동등한 권리를 갖는다.

statement: Which of these is a responsibility of Australian citizens aged 18 years or over?

answers.answer: To attend local council meetings
To vote in elections
To have a current Australian passport

comment: 18세 이상 호주 시민권자의 의무는? 선거에서의 투표

statement: Who is the leader of a local council?

answers.answer: Mayor or Shire President
Councillor
Chief Minister

comment: 18세 이상 호주 시민권자의 의무는? 소집시 배심원 역할 수행

statement: Which of these statements about passports is correct?

answers.answer: Australian citizens can apply for an Australian passport
Permanent residents can hold an Australian passport
Australian citizens need a passport and visa to return to Australia

comment: 여권에 대한 설명 중 바른 것은? 호주시민은 호주여권 신청 가능.

statement: Which of these statements about voting in Australian elections is correct?

answers.answer: People are free and safe to vote for any candidate
Voting is by a show of hands
People must write their name on their vote

comment: 호주선거에 대한 바른 설명? 자유롭고 안전하게 원하는 후보자에게 투표가능.

statement: What happened in Australia on 1 January 1901?

answers.answer: The Australian Constitution was changed by a referendum
The Australian Constitution came into effect
The Australian and New Zealand Army Corps was formed

comment: 1901년 1월 1일엔 무슨 일이? 호주 헌법이 발효되었다.

statement: What is the name of the legal document that sets out the rules for the government of Australia?

answers.answer: The Australian Federation
The Australian Commonwealth
The Australian Constitution

comment: 호주정부의 법규를 정한 법률문서? 헌법

statement: What is a referendum?

answers.answer: A vote to change the government
A vote to change the Australian Constitution
A vote to change the Prime Minister

comment: 국민투표에 해당하는 것? 헌법을 바꾸기 위한 투표.

statement: Which arm of government has the power to interpret and apply laws?

answers.answer: Legislative
Executive
Judicial

comment: 법 해석과 적용하는 힘을 가지는 권력? 사법. Judicial -> Judge

statement: Which of these is a role of the Governor-General?

answers.answer: The appointment of state premiers
The signing of Bills passed by the Australian Parliament
The appointment of the Head of State

comment: 총독의 역할? 호주국회에서 통과된 법안에 서명.

statement: Which of these statements about state governments is correct?

answers.answer: All states have the same constitution
Each state has its own constitution
The states have no constitution

comment: 정부에 대한 바른 설명? 주마다 헌법이 따로 있다.

statement: What is the name given to the party or coalition of parties with the second largest number of members in the House of Representatives?

answers.answer: The Government
The Opposition
The Senate

comment: 두번째로 의석수가 많은 당을 뭐라고 하나? 여당.

statement: What is the name of a proposal to make a law in parliament?

answers.answer: Royal Assent
Bill
Debate

comment: 의회에서 법개정을 위한 제안? 법안. Royal Assent=국왕재가

statement: Who maintains peace and order in Australia?

answers.answer: Public servants
Police
Lawyers

comment: 평화와 질서를 지키는 역할? 경찰.
